text: The underling attends to matters both civil and military in their assigned commanderies; matters that you cannot spare your attention for.

Originally a title held by Zhang Jue himself, the General of Heaven is responsible for ensuring the Will of Heaven is correctly interpreted and carried out.\\n\\nThis office can only be held by [[b]]scholar[[/b]] characters.\\n\\n[[col:scope_description]]Increases industry income and provides bonuses to local morale and public order[[/col]]
Only the wisest amongst the tribes are fit to advise their leader, and only a foolish leader would ignore their sage and tested advice.
The director is responsible keeping the officers disciplined and in excellent shape.
The {{tr:chancellor}} is the chief civil officer, the first of your appointed ministers and second only to you in the court hierarchy.
The grand commandant is your commander-in-chief, with supreme operational oversight in military matters.\\n\\nCharacters in this position become part of your [[b]]faction council[[/b]].
Local leaders supervise life in the commanderies, ensuring that the people are provided with wisdom and guidance.
Power decentralised is power consolidated. Administrators oversee both civil and military matters within their assigned commanderies.
At a modest salary of 2,000 shi, the minister of finance controls the imperial treasury, overseeing state expenses in conjunction with the minister steward.
You must have a next-in-line to succeed you, in case the worst should happen.
Knowledge, once learned, must be passed on - that is the eternal duty of the scholar.
The unbending negotiator ensures your cultural differences do not negatively impact diplomatic relations whilst keeping your own ministers in line.
There is much a general learns managing the logistics of an army.

The minister of the imperial household is primarily concerned with the security of the head of the imperial family, both within and without the imperial palace. For this most important of tasks, they are paid 2,000 shi a year.
The highest official position in the government, the imperial chancellor commands a salary of 10,000 shi and is responsible for each and every civil servant in the administration.
The grand tutor advises officials in foreign affairs and personal conduct when dealing with envoys.\\n\\nCharacters in this position become part of your [[b]]faction council[[/b]].
To teach is to inspire the uninspired, and empower the powerless. It is selfless, and utterly vital.
Mathematics is the universal language of logic and this man studied the art well.
Matters of the mystic and the supernatural fall under the purview of the minister of ceremonies, who commands a salary of 2,000 shi for their service to the empire.
The minister of the imperial clan is responsible - at 2,000 shi a year - for recording and reporting on the conduct of the imperial family.
Commanding far more than just their impressive salary of 10,000 shi, the grand commandant is the supreme military commander of all imperial forces.
You must have an next-in-line to succeed you in case the worst should happen.
The grand tutor advises officials in foreign affairs and personal conduct when dealing with envoys.\\n\\nCharacters in this position become part of your [[b]]faction council[[/b]].
You have taken tentative steps towards enlightenment. As your understanding grows, so too does your skill.
The minister herald draws a wage of 2,000 shi and acts as chief seneschal to the empire, receiving all dignitaries, state guests and members of the imperial family within the empire.
The southlands of the Nanman are vast, bursting with myriad cultures and peoples. As a single leader cannot be everywhere at once, local chiefs are relied upon to maintain order and keep the peace.
Only the most trusted and wise are seen as capable of advising their liege on matters of leadership.

This title was originally held by Zhang Bao. The General of the Land is responsible for all living things on earth.\\n\\nThis office can only be held by [[b]]veteran[[/b]] characters.\\n\\n[[col:scope_description]]Increases peasantry income and provides bonuses to local construction cost and retinue upkeep[[/col]]
The grand excellency manages affairs of the treasury and oversees development projects in your commanderies. \\n\\nCharacters in this position become part of your [[b]]faction council[[/b]].
Knowledge of the land is not only applicable to matters of warfare.
The relentless enforcer gets the most out of your men on the battlefield whilst keeping those at home quiet.
The minister of the guards is charged with matters of security, including the guards assigned to the imperial palaces. This duty comes with a salary of 2000 shi.
As the chief legal officer of the state, the minister of justice is charged with reviewing and ruling on matter of both provicincial and imperial law. For his service, he is paid 2,000 shi.
The tribal council is a most venerated group, whose sage advice is cherished greatly by their leader. \\n\\n As you gain the fealty of more major tribes, the council will grow accordingly.
State enterprises provide employment opprtunities to give the common man promise of a better future.

Zhang Liang originally held this title. Its role is to be a bridge between heaven and earth and maintain harmony.\\n\\nThis office can only be held by [[b]]healer[[/b]] characters.\\n\\n[[col:scope_description]]Increases commerce income and provides bonuses to local populationi growth and replenishment[[/col]]
Your second in command - who are you to trust if you cannot trust them?
The incense master is your ceremonial officer and oversees inductions into your service. They are the first of your appointed ministers and second only to you in the council hierarchy.
You must have an heir to succeed you, chosen from your family or, failing that, your most loyal companion.
The grand architect is responsible for the construction, maintenance and repair of imperial and official buildings. \\n\\nCharacters in this position become part of your [[b]]faction council[[/b]].
The master of arms has supreme strategic oversight over military matters, ensuring you get the most from your plundering.
The great commander ensures that the people are reminded to live in harmony with the earth and encourages the virtue of frugality.\\n\\nThis office can only be held by [[b]]veteran[[/b]] characters.

The great healer is responsible for the well-being of the people. He espouses compassion and ensures the sick and the weak are tended to across the land.\\n\\nThis office can only be held by [[b]]healer[[/b]] characters.
The minister steward is charged with arrangement of the emperor's personal needs, from food and drink to health and entertainment. This duty comes with a salary of 2,000 shi.
A man who can motivate the hearts of the people will be in no short supply of able men.
These are notable individuals, currently known to you, who are ready to offer their services to your faction. Recruit a candidate into an available role to bring them into your court.
The grand excellency manages the affairs of the treasury and oversees development projects in your commanderies. \\n\\nCharacters in this position become part of your [[b]]faction council[[/b]].
This position is a military representative to the government, liaising between civic and military departments of the government.
Knowing of the activities of the entire realm falls to the investigator â€“ even those occurring in foreign courts.
The provincial advisor is a representative of the central government, sent to the commanderies to supervise and control.

The great learned one is responsible for understanding the mysteries contained within the sacred scriptures, and the embodiment of humility.\\n\\nThis office can only be held by [[b]]scholar[[/b]] characters.
The {{tr:chancellor}} is the chief civil officer, the first of your appointed ministers and second only to you in the court hierarchy.
The grand commandant is your commander-in-chief, with supreme operational oversight in military matters.\\n\\nCharacters in this position become part of your [[b]]faction council[[/b]].
Through medical treatment and sound advice, the court physician maintain members of the court in their best shape.
As the supreme authority for imperial law and political affairs, this grand excellency takes a not-insignificant salary of 10,000 shi for their work governing the populace.
The grand director is the head of the officials, overseeing community organisation in your commanderies.\\n\\nCharacters in this position become part of your [[b]]faction council[[/b]].
You need not spread yourself thinly to deal with every single matter under your jurisdiction. Attendants are members of your court who are currently on assignment, doing your bidding.
{{tr:prime_minister_description}} \\n\\nCharacters in this position become part of your [[b]]faction council[[/b]].
The grand excellency of works presides of all imperial infrastructure and related projects, including the treasury. Needless to say, their 10,000 shi salary is well-earned.
Through strict oversight, the director is able to appoint and remove inefficient officials.
The chief smuggler ensures your armies' pockets and bellies are full whilst raiding.

Drawing a modest salary of 2,000 shi, the minister coachman administers the use of horses and carriages from the imperial stables, as well as supplying the military with cavalry and all associated equipment.
The director helps to maintain and investigate the treasury, ensuring that no-one is skimming off the top.
